noun.description: A structure consisting of a series of bars or steps between two upright lengths of wood, metal, or rope, used for climbing up or down something.
A vertical strip of unraveled fabric in tights or stockings; a run.

verb.description: (with reference to tights or stockings) develop or cause to develop a run.
examples: I laddered my tights as I arrived this morning
the first time I put them on, one of the stockings laddered

origin: Old English hlǣd(d)er, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch leer and German Leiter.
